page.title: 05Education.Newport school.
page.content: Our village school is over a hundred years old.During the last four years it has been modernised.The school house adjoining the school,which was built for the head teacher, has been converted to become part of the school.Further building of newly designed classrooms,intended for two teachers to team teach their classes, in L-shaped rooms,will replace the existing five classrooms.The new building also includes a new hall and kitchen.It is hoped that the Building work will begin in 1986.At the moment the school is on a split site.The two top classes of our junior school are housed in an annex building, adjacent to the school.This building was erected at the beginning of the second world war.It was a nursery unit built to care for children whose mothers were working on the land.
